intro: Duguetia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf duguetia, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The plant is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking foliage and floral display.
